item.description:
It looks like my road cycling plans were a bust this week. How about going back to the tried and true East Bay bike path?

Join me this Sunday at 10:45 AM on a trip from Barrington on the East Bay Bikepath.

The entire path is roughly 26 miles round trip, but since we're starting from the middle, riders can simply do half the ride for a total of around 13 miles.

We'll meet ON THE BIKE PATH in front of Shaws, right next to the white wooden signboards.

I'm going to be wearing my stylish bike helmet, and I suggest (but do not require) that you do the same.

There are a few (non-alcoholic) beverage and ice cream vendors on the way, so feel free to bring a few dollars for refreshments.
item.how_to_find_us: I have a red car and a red bike, also I have a cell: 401-699-7304
item.name: Biking the East Bay on Sunday 13 OR 26 miles
